purpose: Create model-ready features for predicting taxi trip duration based on trip and driver information.
fe_steps: Standardize pickup_datetime and dropoff_datetime columns to ISO 8601 format
Calculate trip_duration in minutes from pickup_datetime and dropoff_datetime
Clean and convert fare_amount to numeric, replacing non-numeric or missing values with the median fare
Fill missing passenger_count values with the mode passenger count
Normalize pickup_location and dropoff_location to title case
One-hot encode pickup_location and dropoff_location
Create a trip_distance_km column by converting trip_distance from miles to kilometers
Bucketize trip_duration into short (<15 min), medium (15-30 min), and long (>30 min) trips
Standardize trip_distance_km and fare_amount columns
Create fare_per_km feature by dividing fare_amount by trip_distance_km

fe_steps: Standardize date formats in AdmissionDate and DischargeDate to YYYY-MM-DD

Standardize Energy_Usage_kWh column to zero mean and unit variance

purpose: Create model-ready features for predicting taxi trip duration based on trip details and driver information.
fe_steps: Parse pickup_datetime and dropoff_datetime columns into consistent datetime format
Calculate trip_duration_minutes as difference between dropoff_datetime and pickup_datetime in minutes
Extract pickup_hour from pickup_datetime
Impute missing passenger_count values with the median passenger count
Standardize payment_type values to lowercase
Convert trip_distance to numeric miles, removing stray text and converting any invalid values to median distance
One-hot encode payment_type
Create a binary feature long_trip indicating if trip_distance is greater than 8 miles
Calculate fare_per_mile by dividing fare_amount by trip_distance
Impute missing fare_amount with median fare
Bucketize pickup_hour into time_of_day categories: Morning (5-11), Afternoon (12-17), Evening (18-22), Night (23-4)

purpose: Engineer features from raw patient visit data to predict hospital readmission risk.
fe_steps: Standardize Visit_Date to ISO format YYYY-MM-DD
Fill missing Age with median Age
Normalize Gender values to lowercase 'male' or 'female'
Map Diagnosis_Code variants to three categories: 'Diabetes', 'Hypertension', or 'Other'
Extract systolic and diastolic blood pressure as separate numeric columns from Blood_Pressure
Impute missing Blood_Pressure values with median systolic and diastolic values
Convert Weight_kg to numeric and fill missing with mean weight
Convert Smoker_Status to binary: 1 if yes/YES/Y, else 0
Calculate BMI assuming height of 1.7 meters for all patients
Bucketize Age into 'Young' (<40), 'Middle-aged' (40-59), and 'Senior' (60+)

purpose: Engineer features to predict user engagement levels on social media posts by cleaning and transforming raw data from user interactions.
fe_steps: Standardize Post_Date into ISO format yyyy-mm-dd
Convert Likes, Comments, Shares and User_Followers to numeric, handling 'NaN', missing values and stray strings (e.g., 'Two Hundred', '1.2k')
Normalize User_ID to lowercase
Standardize Post_Type values to lowercase
Create Post_Age_days as difference between Post_Date and latest post date in dataset
Bucketize Post_Length into 'short', 'medium', and 'long' based on length thresholds
Fill missing Comments and Shares with zero
Compute Engagement_Score as sum of Likes, Comments, and Shares divided by User_Followers
One-hot encode Post_Type categories

fe_steps: Standardize Crop names to title case
Convert Planting_Date to ISO YYYY-MM-DD format
Impute missing Soil_Moisture values using median
Convert Soil_Moisture from percentages and strings to float decimals
Convert Temperature to Celsius as float values
Normalize Weather_Condition into three categories: Sunny, Cloudy, Rainy
Encode Yield_Quality as ordinal numeric scale: Low=0, Medium=1, High=2
Extract day_of_week from Planting_Date
Calculate moisture_to_temp_ratio as Soil_Moisture divided by Temperature

purpose: Engineer robust time and categorical features to improve energy consumption forecasting accuracy.
fe_steps: Standardize the Timestamp column to ISO 8601 date-time format
Extract day_of_week and hour from the Timestamp column
Fill missing Consumption_MWh values using the median Consumption_MWh per Region and Energy_Source
Normalize capitalization in Region and Energy_Source columns
One-hot encode the Energy_Source categorical variable
Encode Operator names as lowercase and fill missing values with 'unknown'
Create a temperature_bin categorical feature by bucketizing Temperature_C into 'low', 'medium', and 'high'
Compute consumption_per_degree as Consumption_MWh divided by Temperature_C
Standardize numeric columns Consumption_MWh, Temperature_C, and consumption_per_degree

fe_steps: Standardize dates in OperationDate column to yyyy-mm-dd format
Convert Temperature and Pressure columns to numeric, coercing errors to NaN
Fill missing Temperature and Pressure values with median values of their respective columns
Normalize operator names to lowercase
One-hot encode Operator column
Create a new binary feature 'IsFault' mapping Status 'Fault' to 1 and others to 0
Extract day_of_week from OperationDate
Create a rolling average Temperature over previous 2 records per MachineID sorted by OperationDate
Create a binary feature 'HighPressure' where Pressure > 100 is 1 else 0

purpose: Engineer features to predict machine failure within the next 7 days based on sensor readings and operational logs.
fe_steps: Standardize Log_Date to ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)
Fill missing Temperature_C values with the median temperature
Fill missing Pressure_psi values with the median pressure
Map Error_Code variants to standardized uppercase codes (ERR01, ERR02, ERR03, or None)
Fill missing Operator_Shift with the most frequent shift and standardize capitalization
Convert Run_Hours to numeric, replacing 'not recorded' with median run hours
Extract day_of_week from Log_Date
Create a binary feature Has_Error indicating presence of an error code
Bucketize Temperature_C into Low (<78), Medium (78-84), High (>84)
Standardize numeric columns Temperature_C, Pressure_psi, Run_Hours

fe_steps: Standardize all ProductCategory values to lowercase and correct inconsistent variants (e.g., 'home & kitchen' to 'home_kitchen').
Convert SessionDate to a uniform ISO date format (YYYY-MM-DD) and fill missing dates with the median date.
Convert Quantity to integer, replacing written numbers ('Two', 'One') with numeric equivalents and filling missing with 1.

Create a new feature 'total_spent' by multiplying Price by Quantity.
Extract 'day_of_week' from SessionDate as a categorical feature.
One-hot encode ProductCategory.
One-hot encode PaymentMethod.

purpose: Engineer features to improve customer churn prediction by cleaning and enriching call and service usage data.

purpose: Engineer features from raw user activity data to improve prediction of user engagement levels on a social media platform.

purpose: Engineer features from raw social media user activity data to improve engagement prediction models.

Standardize numeric columns: posts, tweets, followers, friends, account_age_days, engagement_score

purpose: Engineer features to predict user engagement levels on social media posts based on user activity and post metadata.
fe_steps: Standardize post_date to ISO format YYYY-MM-DD
Fill missing likes and comments with the median values of their respective columns
Convert user_followers from string with suffixes (k, K) to integer counts
Correct likes column by setting non-numeric entries to median likes
One-hot encode post_type into separate binary columns
Create engagement_score as the sum of likes, comments, and shares
Extract day_of_week from standardized post_date
Bucketize user_followers into three categories: Small (<1000), Medium (1000-2000), Large (>2000)
Fill missing shares with zero
Normalize engagement_score using min-max scaling

purpose: Engineer features to predict taxi trip duration based on trip details and timestamps.
fe_steps: Parse Pickup_DateTime and Dropoff_DateTime columns into datetime objects with a consistent format
Calculate trip_duration in minutes as the difference between Dropoff_DateTime and Pickup_DateTime
Convert Passenger_Count to numeric, handling text such as 'Three' by mapping to 3
Clean Trip_Distance column by removing non-numeric values and imputing missing values with median
Standardize Payment_Type values to lowercase ('card' or 'cash')
One-hot encode Payment_Type and Vendor_ID columns
Extract Pickup_hour and Pickup_day_of_week from Pickup_DateTime
Create a binary feature Rush_Hour indicating if Pickup_hour is between 7-9 AM or 4-6 PM
Apply log transform to Trip_Distance to reduce skewness
Standardize numeric columns: Passenger_Count, Trip_Distance (log transformed), and trip_duration

purpose: Engineer features from student enrollment and performance data to predict course completion likelihood.
fe_steps: Standardize Enrollment_Date to ISO format YYYY-MM-DD
Fill missing Attendance_Rate values with the mean attendance rate
Normalize Course_Name to consistent lowercase with underscores (e.g., math101)
Convert Grade to numeric, replacing 'not available' with median grade
Extract day_of_week from Last_Submission dates
Map Feedback_Score to numeric scale: excellent=5, good=4, average=3, avg=3
Compute days_since_enrollment as difference between today (2023-06-10) and Enrollment_Date
Bucketize Attendance_Rate into categories: low (<80), medium (80-89), high (90+)
One-hot encode Course_Name
Standardize numeric columns: Attendance_Rate, Grade, Feedback_Score, days_since_enrollment

purpose: Engineer clinical and demographic features to predict hospital readmission risk within 30 days.

One-hot encode Diagnosis_Code
Create a binary feature Previous_Readmission_Flag indicating if Previous_Readmissions > 0
Standardize numeric columns Length_of_Stay, BMI, and Previous_Readmissions

purpose: Engineer features from raw patient data to improve prediction of hospital readmission risk.

Create age_group buckets: '<40', '40-60', '>60'

Flag if length_of_stay is longer than 7 days as prolonged_stay
Standardize numeric columns Age, Weight_kg, Systolic_BP, Diastolic_BP

purpose: Engineer features from social media user activity data to predict user engagement levels.

Convert likes, comments, and shares columns to numeric, replacing non-numeric and missing values with zero
Convert followers_count to integer, interpreting 'K' as thousand
Extract day_of_week from post_date
Create total_interactions as the sum of likes, comments, and shares
Calculate engagement_rate as total_interactions divided by followers_count
One-hot encode post_type

purpose: Engineer clean and informative features from raw patient visit data to predict hospital readmission risk.

Trim whitespace and standardize DiagnosisCode to uppercase
Extract systolic and diastolic values from BloodPressure column into separate numeric columns
Impute missing numeric values in BloodPressure and Cholesterol columns with median of respective columns
Convert Cholesterol 'high' string to numeric threshold value 240
Map Smoker column values to binary indicator (1 for yes, 0 for no)
Calculate DaysSinceLastVisit as difference in days between VisitDate and LastVisit
Bucketize Age into 'Young' (<=40), 'Middle-aged' (41-60), and 'Senior' (>60)
One-hot encode DiagnosisCode categories

purpose: Create model-ready features for predicting taxi ride durations by cleaning raw trip data and engineering time and distance-related features.
fe_steps: Standardize PickupDateTime and DropoffDateTime to ISO 8601 format and parse as datetime objects
Trim whitespace and convert PickupLocation and DropoffLocation to lowercase
Convert PassengerCount to numeric, impute missing values with median passenger count
Clean FareAmount by removing currency symbols and convert to float
Impute missing TripDistance values by calculating the difference in time multiplied by average speed (assume average speed of 15 mph)
Create trip_duration_minutes as difference between DropoffDateTime and PickupDateTime in minutes
One-hot encode PickupLocation and DropoffLocation
Bucketize trip_duration_minutes into short (<15), medium (15-30), and long (>30) trips
Create fare_per_mile feature by dividing FareAmount by TripDistance
Extract day_of_week from PickupDateTime as a categorical feature

purpose: Create model-ready features for predicting taxi fare amount based on trip details and timestamps.
fe_steps: Standardize Pickup_Date and Dropoff_Date columns into YYYY-MM-DD format
Parse Pickup_Time and Dropoff_Time columns into 24-hour HH:MM format
Combine Pickup_Date and Pickup_Time into a single datetime column named Pickup_Datetime
Combine Dropoff_Date and Dropoff_Time into a single datetime column named Dropoff_Datetime
Calculate trip_duration_minutes as the difference between Dropoff_Datetime and Pickup_Datetime in minutes
Fill missing Passenger_Count values with the mode of the column
Correct Fare_Amount values by replacing non-numeric entries with median fare
Convert Payment_Type to lowercase and map 'cash' and 'credit' variants to standardized categories
Create a binary feature is_peak_hours indicating if Pickup_Datetime is during 7-9AM or 4-6PM on weekdays
Compute fare_per_mile by dividing Fare_Amount by Trip_Distance
Bucketize trip_duration_minutes into short (<15), medium (15-30), and long (>30) duration categories

purpose: Engineer features to predict customer purchase propensity based on browsing and transaction history.
fe_steps: Normalize date formats in FirstVisit and LastPurchase columns to YYYY-MM-DD
Fill missing LastPurchase dates with the corresponding FirstVisit date
Convert TotalSpent to numeric by removing currency symbols and commas
Impute missing TotalSpent values with the median TotalSpent
Standardize FavoriteCategory values to lowercase and unify variants (e.g., 'electronics', 'elecTronics')
Fill missing VisitFrequency with the median VisitFrequency
Extract days_since_last_purchase as difference between LastPurchase and FirstVisit
Bucketize VisitFrequency into categories: low (<=3), medium (4-6), high (>=7)
One-hot encode FavoriteCategory
Log transform TotalSpent to reduce skewness

purpose: Engineer features from raw energy consumption and weather data to improve short-term electricity demand forecasting.
fe_steps: Parse and standardize the Timestamp column into datetime format
Extract hour_of_day and day_of_week from the Timestamp
Convert Energy_Consumption_kWh to numeric, handling 'not available' as missing values
Impute missing Energy_Consumption_kWh values using the mean consumption of the same Meter_ID
Fill missing Temperature_C values with the median temperature
Standardize capitalization in Weather_Condition and map variants to consistent categories: Sunny, Cloudy, Rain
One-hot encode the Weather_Condition categories
Create a binary feature is_peak_hour indicating if hour_of_day is between 7 and 19 inclusive
Compute a rolling average of Energy_Consumption_kWh over the previous 2 hours for each Meter_ID
Normalize Energy_Consumption_kWh and Temperature_C columns using min-max scaling

purpose: Engineer robust numerical and categorical features from raw real estate listings data to improve price prediction accuracy.
fe_steps: Parse ListingDate into a consistent date format and extract the month and year as separate features
Clean Price by removing non-numeric characters and convert to integer, treating 'k' as thousand
Fill missing Area_sqft values with the median area
Fill missing Bathrooms values with the median number of bathrooms
Standardize PropertyType values to lowercase and strip whitespace
One-hot encode PropertyType into separate binary columns
Calculate Price_per_sqft by dividing cleaned Price by Area_sqft
Create Age_of_Property feature by subtracting YearBuilt from the year of the listing
Fill missing YearBuilt with the mode year
Bucketize Bedrooms into categories: 'Small' (1-2), 'Medium' (3), 'Large' (4+)

Create Temperature_Celsius_Squared feature by squaring Temperature_C

purpose: Engineer features to predict machine failure within a production line based on sensor readings and maintenance logs.
fe_steps: Standardize all date columns (RunDate, Last_Maintenance) to ISO format yyyy-mm-dd
Impute missing Temperature_C values with the median temperature
Convert Temperature_C values containing non-numeric strings to NaN and then impute
Impute missing Vibration_mms values with mean vibration value
Normalize Operator names to consistent capitalization format (e.g., Title Case)
Calculate Days_Since_Last_Maintenance as difference between RunDate and Last_Maintenance
Encode Status as binary label: OK=0, FAIL=1
One-hot encode Operator column
Bucketize Temperature_C into three ranges: Low (<88), Medium (88-90), High (>90)
Log transform Vibration_mms to reduce skewness

purpose: Engineer and clean features from raw real estate listings to enable accurate price prediction modeling.
fe_steps: Standardize the ListingDate column to ISO YYYY-MM-DD format.
Fill missing Price values using median Price per PropertyType.
Convert Price values with 'K' suffix to numeric by multiplying by 1000.
Fill missing Area_sqft values using median Area per PropertyType.
Fill missing Bathrooms with median bathrooms for corresponding Bedrooms count.
Standardize Location values to title case (e.g., 'Downtown', 'Suburb').
Create a new feature price_per_sqft by dividing Price by Area_sqft.
Extract year_listed as integer from ListingDate.
Calculate property_age as year_listed minus YearBuilt, and fill missing YearBuilt with median YearBuilt.
One-hot encode PropertyType and Location columns.
Bucketize property_age into categories: 'New'(<=10), 'Mid'(11-20), 'Old'(>20).

purpose: Engineer features from raw climate sensor data to improve accuracy in temperature anomaly detection models.
fe_steps: Standardize all Station_ID values to uppercase
Parse Date column into a consistent YYYY-MM-DD format
Impute missing Temperature values with the station's daily average temperature
Convert Wind_Speed_km_h from string with units to numeric and impute missing values with median wind speed
Fill missing Humidity values with mean humidity across all stations
Map Weather_Condition to a standardized lowercase set: sunny, cloudy, partly cloudy
Create a binary feature Is_Precipitation indicating presence (1) or absence (0) of precipitation
Extract day_of_week from Date column
Calculate Temperature_Humidity_Index as Temperature * Humidity / 100
One-hot encode the Weather_Condition feature

purpose: Engineer features from farm field and weather data to improve crop yield prediction accuracy.
fe_steps: Standardize Crop_Type to title case without leading/trailing spaces
Parse Plant_Date into a consistent date format and extract month and day_of_week
Convert Soil_pH to numeric, imputing missing values with the median Soil_pH
Convert Avg_Temp(°C) to numeric, replacing non-numeric entries with the median temperature
Impute missing Rainfall_mm values with the average rainfall across all fields
Create a new feature 'Growing_Days' as the difference in days between Plant_Date and a fixed harvest date of 2023-05-15
Bucketize Soil_pH into three categories: acidic (<6.5), neutral (6.5-7.5), alkaline (>7.5)
One-hot encode Crop_Type
Compute yield_per_rainfall as Harvest_Weight_kg divided by Rainfall_mm
Standardize numeric features: Soil_pH, Avg_Temp(°C), Rainfall_mm, Harvest_Weight_kg, Growing_Days, yield_per_rainfall

purpose: Create model-ready features for predicting taxi trip duration based on trip details and timestamps.
fe_steps: Parse pickup_datetime and dropoff_datetime into datetime objects with consistent format
Calculate trip_duration in minutes as the difference between dropoff_datetime and pickup_datetime
Fill missing passenger_count values with the median passenger count
Standardize capitalization of pickup_location and dropoff_location to title case
Correct fare_amount by replacing non-numeric entries with median fare
One-hot encode payment_type into separate binary columns for Card and Cash
Extract pickup_hour and pickup_day_of_week from pickup_datetime
Create a new feature is_rush_hour indicating if pickup_hour is within typical rush hours (7-9 AM or 4-6 PM)
Bucketize passenger_count into categories: 1, 2, 3, 4+ passengers
Log-transform fare_amount to reduce skewness

purpose: Engineer features from raw climate observation data to improve accuracy in forecasting temperature anomalies.
fe_steps: Standardize Date column to ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)
Convert StationID to uppercase
Impute missing numeric values in Temp_C, Humidity, and WindSpeed_kmh columns with column medians
Convert Humidity values with text (e.g., 'Ca. 55') to numeric by extracting digits
Replace non-numeric WindSpeed_kmh entries (e.g., 'seven') with median WindSpeed
Create a binary feature 'Is_Rainy' indicating whether Condition contains 'rain' (case-insensitive)
One-hot encode Condition after standardizing categories to title case
Extract day_of_week from Date
Create a rolling average Temp_C over previous 2 days for each StationID (forward filled for first days)
Standardize numeric columns Temp_C, Humidity, WindSpeed_kmh, and rolling average Temp_C
